paper_abstract: Let G = (U boolean OR W, epsilon) be a bipartite graph with disjoint vertex sets U and W, edge set epsilon, and girth g. This correspondence presents an algorithm for counting the number of cycles of length g, g + 2, and g + 4 incident upon every vertex in U boolean OR W. The proposed cycle counting algorithm consists of integer matrix operations and its complexity grows as O(gn(3)) where n. = max(vertical bar U vertical bar, vertical bar W vertical bar).
paper_title: An algorithm for counting short cycles in bipartite graphs
